definition: The earliest known stone tool technology, dating from 2.6+ million years ago, characterized by simple stone tools that required planning and foresight to manufacture
A stone tool technology spanning 1.7-0.1 million years ago, characterized by symmetrical hand axes that demanded greater motor control and cognitive sophistication than earlier tools
The concept that thinking occurs through physical interaction with the world, particularly relevant to tool-making where cognitive development happens through hands-on manipulation and creation
Fine motor control and hand-brain coordination that was both required for and developed by tool-making, creating evolutionary pressure for increasingly sophisticated motor capabilities
Higher-level cognitive processes including planning, foresight, and problem-solving that were enhanced through tool-making activities and drove brain development

Hannah Arendt's philosophical concept defining humans by their fundamental ability to shape their environment and fate through making tools and objects, positioning tool-making as core human identity rather than mere capability

The evolutionary cycle where tool-making drove brain development through enhanced executive function and motor skills, which in turn enabled more sophisticated tool creation, creating selective pressure for larger brains
Model Context Protocol - a standard for connecting AI models to external data sources and services, allowing models to access content from various applications and databases
Модульные возможности, расширяющие функциональность Claude - папки с файлами, содержащие промпты и код для выполнения специфических задач
AI-ассистент от Anthropic, используемый для программирования и других задач
Общая память сессии с моделью, в которую попадает история взаимодействий и которая влияет на производительность

A self-contained package containing all actions and materials needed to teach Claude to perform a specific task, similar to a skill for a person. Can include text files, scripts, templates, and other resources.
AI-driven programming approach where interactions are managed through prompts and AI agents rather than traditional code
A note-taking application that stores files locally, which can be integrated with AI assistants through MCP
A tool or service used for web scraping and content extraction, mentioned in context of a skill that can generate scientific templates
Large Language Model - AI systems that can process and generate text, mentioned as an alternative to Claude for certain tasks
An AI assistant that can write code and scripts, as referenced in the context of writing programming scripts
A coding automation feature in Claude that can execute complex multi-step tasks, often converting from software 1.0 utilities and scripts to software 3.0 AI-driven tools
A command-line interface tool for interacting with Claude AI, distinct from Claude Desktop which is a GUI application
A startup company or early-stage business venture, often technology-focused
Entrepreneurship - the activity of starting and running business ventures
Values-oriented entrepreneurs who focus on meaningful impact rather than just profit
A new business venture or entrepreneurial project that requires focus on money and revenue generation to succeed
A psychological term referring to the degree of alignment between one's actions and personal values
One's own perception or understanding of themselves and their characteristics
A field of study in psychology focused on goal-setting, with several major schools of thought including one from Edwin Locke
